means.word_mean: 规则的,稳定的,有秩序的

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 18th cent.: from French systématique, via late Latin from late Greek sustēmatikos, from sustēma (see system)

entry.tran: 成体系的;系统的;有条理的;按既定计划的
entry.def: Something that is done in a systematic way is done according to a fixed plan, in a thorough and efficient way.

example.ex: They went about their business in a systematic way...
example.tran: 他们按部就班地做生意。

example.ex: They had not found any evidence of a systematic attempt to rig the ballot.
example.tran: 他们没有发现任何证据证明有人企图全面操纵投票。

sentences.sentence: "a series of orderly actions at regular hours"

stems_affixes.word_buile: charisma魅力,感召力+atic有……性质的→adj.有魅力的
dogma教条+atic有……性质的→adj.教条的,教义的
emblem象征,徽章+atic有……性质的→adj.作为象征的
err错误+atic有……性质的→被人认为错误的→古怪的
fan入迷者+atic有……性质的→adj.狂热的,盲信的 n.狂热者
pragm行动+atic有……性质的→adj.实际的,实用主义的
problem问题+atic有……性质的→adj.有问题的
system系统+atic有……性质的→adj.系统的,体系的
phlegm痰,古人认为痰多者冷静自控,沉着+atic有……性质的→adj.冷静的,冷淡的
fan入迷者+atic有……性质的→adj.狂热的,盲信的 n.狂热者

Sentence.sentence: If the United States wants to keep up in the global economic race, it will have to pay systematic attention to graduating minorities, not just enrolling them.
This scenario is common in newsrooms that lack a systematic way to filter story suggestions
Your gut reaction (本能反应) and dismissive rejection, even of a worthless idea, might not qualify as systematic or fair.
